abstracts.cdata!:
The Philippines Early Childhood
            Development Project has a satisfactory outcome, is likely to
            be sustainable, and has a substantial institutional
            development impact. The performances of the Borrower and the
            Bank are rated satisfactory. In addition to more well-known
            lessons learned comparable operations such as the need for
            local level involvement, strategic communications
            development early in project and the importance of
            integrating services, this operation provides other
            interesting lessons such as: 1) focusing on nutrition within
            an early childhood development program; 2) the value added
            of a strong evaluation of the ECD program in addition to
            regular monitoring; 3) the use of baseline surveys; 4) the
            choice of lead agency in a multi-sectoral operation; 5) the
            scope of ECD services; 6) the use of matching grants to
            encourage local government financing; 7) the successful
            combination of legislation and the information, education,
            and communication thrust; and 8) embedding the project
            management office within the organic structure of the lead
            implementing agencies.
